title_sort: elmer e. stafford to walt whitman, 18 january 1878
title: Elmer E. Stafford to Walt Whitman, 18 January 1878
text: from Elmer | Jan 18 '78Jan.January 18. 1878Dear WaltI have received your letter and very glad to hear from you. I am well and hope this letter will find you the same.Dear Walt, I would like to see you. there is nothing very new, the W is clear & the stars is shining very bright, as you stated in your letter you would like to no[know] Wesleys[Wesley's] addressWesley StaffordDixie, Polk CoOregonI would like to come down & stay all night with you I will come down as soon as I can. It is now 4 minutes after 8 oclock I have been hauling wood to daytoday we have been Clearing off the swamp & now are very near don[done]. we are all well. the weather has not been very cold yet but we for snow perty[pretty] soon. I will come down and stay with you some time just as soon as I can if it could be so I would like to be with you all the time. I must end my letter now so it is good by[bye] Dear WaltElmer E. StaffordGlendaleCamden CoNew Jersey Elmer E. Stafford to Walt Whitman, 18 January 1878
